page.title: 15Lawshall & Shimpling Clubs
page.content: In Lawshall Village Hall in recent months there have been: A Ballroom Dance,an artificial ice rink, which was very popular, a Disco to the music of the 1950's & 60's,a very large and well organised Jumble Sale, a 50/50 auction, some Country & Western evenings and a Beetle Drive! Shimpling school hall is used for a ladies keep fit class run of an evening during school term time and arrangements are in hand to start a Beavers Club (pre Cub Scouts) to also meet in the hall. The Bush Inn at Shimpling has a Cribbage Team,Darts Team and at a moments notice will field a football team or tug-of-war team for any local event. They also use the field to the rear of the pub where the Bury Buggy Club meet each Sunday morning (they are a model racing buggy club from nearby Bury St. Edmunds).
